intro: Tepuia vareschii, commonly known as the Trinidadian starfruit, is a flowering plant native to the island of Trinidad. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped fruits that resemble small, yellow-orange starfish. The plant produces small, white flowers with five petals, which are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are ovate and pubescent, with a rough texture. Tepuia vareschii is adapted to the tropical climate of Trinidad and is often found in moist, shaded areas of the forest understory.
